images.description: The hamburger has become the staple of American cuisine and is shared all around the world
images.date: The hamburger gained its popularity in the 1920s and 1930s.

images.description: Tacos are the most notorious food in South America, and for good reason as it has spread throughout the world
images.date: Tacos were an 18th century food for the working man.

images.description: Fish and chips is a staple dish in Europe, and for good reason.
images.date: In the late 19th century, fish and chips started and quickly became a favorite among the countries in Europe.

images.description: The Dumpling is a very versatile dish, countries around the world, but specifically in Asia have made their own variation.
images.date: The dumpling originates from over 2000 years ago in the Eastern Han Dynasty.

images.description: Fufu is a dish that has a dough like consistency that is usually served with various soups.
images.date: Fufu became popular in Africa around the 16th century.

images.description: Meat Pie is a pastrie filled with delicious diced or minced meat and gravy.
images.date: Meat pies started being popular around the late 1940s, and quickly took off from there.

images.description: Hoosh is a stew made of sledging biscuits, pemmican and water. More broadly, it may be a mix of water with dried meat, fat, and a grain-based thickening agent.
images.date: Created in the early 1900s for the first antarctic expeditions.
